awd_abstract_narration: Freshman women are the target population for this project                  at Dartmouth College, since decisions made during the freshman                  year are considered to be crucial in determining whether or not                 a student will major in science.  The project offers:  (1) an                   opportunity, generally not available during the freshman year,                  to work in research; (2) one-on-one work with a science faculty                 member who can serve as a present and future role model; (3)                    "hands-on" laboratory work and firsthand experience with                        scientific inquiry; (4) two special Science Seminars, one each                  term; (5) an "Older and Wiser" program to pair participants                     with senior women majoring in science; (6) field trips to local                 and regional science and engineering firms and laboratories;                    and (7) workshops and panel discussions featuring science                       majors, graduate students, faculty and non-academic scientists.                 Vigorous campus support provides a strong foundation for this                   work.
org_div_long_name: Div. of Equity for Excellence in STEM
